user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_setattr:
```c
int lfs_setattr(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path,
        uint8_t type, const void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_setattr(%p, \"%s\", %"PRIu8", %p, %"PRIu32")",
            (void*)lfs, path, type, buffer, size);

    err = lfs_setattr_(lfs, path, type, buffer, size);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_setattr -> %d", err);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return err;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_setattr:
static int lfs_setattr_(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path,
        uint8_t type, const void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    if (size > lfs->attr_max) {
        return LFS_ERR_NOSPC;
    }

    return lfs_commitattr(lfs, path, type, buffer, size);
}
...
static int lfs_commitattr(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path,
        uint8_t type, const void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    lfs_mdir_t cwd;
    lfs_stag_t tag = lfs_dir_find(lfs, &cwd, &path, NULL);
    if (tag < 0) {
        return tag;
    }

    uint16_t id = lfs_tag_id(tag);
    if (id == 0x3ff) {
        // special case for root
        id = 0;
        int err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &cwd, lfs->root);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }
    }

    return lfs_dir_commit(lfs, &cwd, LFS_MKATTRS(
            {LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_USERATTR + type, id, size), buffer}));
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the fragment does not declare any pointer type — it merely passes lfs->cfg to the LFS_LOCK macro. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 concerns pointer declarations that should be const-qualified when possible. From the shown code there is no pointer declaration to qualify, and there is no evidence that lfs->cfg could/should be const (LFS_LOCK likely requires a mutable configuration). If the declaration of the cfg member or the prototype of LFS_LOCK were non-modifying but declared without const, then that declaration (not this call site) would be the place to consider a Rule 8.13 violation.
